descriptionHtml:
[center][size=5][b][color=#FF8C00]ConSkrybe[/color][/b][/size]
[size=3][color=#9ACD32][b]Skrybing, plotting and pilfering[/b][/color][/size]
[b]version 4.0[/b]

[size=3][b]Requires [url=http://skse.silverlock.org]Skyrim Script Extender[/url][/b][/size][/center]


[size=5][b][u]Description[/u][/b][/size]

“Console logging, we wantz plz!!” cried the masses, shoveling their nobs. “Here, have at it! Now, don’t bother me until the next patch is out. Avaunt, you knaves! And peace out.” said shadeMe.



[size=5][b][u]Fine Print[/u][/b][/size]

Just pop it in and run the game through the SKSE launcher. All messages, including those that you type into the console, are logged to the plugin's debug log found in the root game directory.

Logging can be toggled in-game by committing the following command into the console: ToggleSkrybing




[size=5][u][b]Compatibility[/b][/u][/size]

Compatible only with TES Skyrim v1.9.32.0. May not be compatible with the Russian build of the game.



[size=5][b][u]Credits[/u][/b][/size]

[color=#F4A460][i]Special thanks[/i][/color] to :[list]
[*][size=2]Ian Patterson, Stephen Abel and Paul Connelly (The SKSE Team) – Words fail me when I attempt to extol these guys for th-heir c-contributio... to ..he TES modd..n. com.i..t...[/size]
[*][size=2]LHammonds – For his Readme generator.[/size]
[/list]
The Rest of the Modding Community – For the inspiration I needed to start modding and all the wonderful mods which I use.
Bethesda – For providing a rather malleable game.



[size=5][u][b]Change Log[/b][/u][/size]

[spoiler][quote]4.0 - Added support for runtime v1.9.32.0
3.0 - Updated for runtime v1.8.151.0, added console command to toggle logging
2.0 – Added support for runtime v1.7.7.0
1.0 - Initial Release[/quote][/spoiler]
author: shadeMe
